The claim was made by Lenny Curry: head of the Republican Party of Florida, during an interview on Bay News 9's "Political Connections" on March 4, 2012.
The expert fact: checkers at PolitiFact analyzed Obama's promises and statements regarding gas prices and found that he did not specifically promise gasoline at $2.50 a gallon.
The national city average for regular un: when Obama took office, was around $1.79, which is close to the claim's statement that gas prices were at $1.68 when Obama took office.
